fields.description:
I've just got a strange thing happening with page history. I have made some changes to a page about 2 hrs ago, but there are 2 odd things occuring:
1) "Since you last logged in" text is showing wrong user (Sarah Lyttle), but when you click on "view" the change is correct. The "Last changed by" user is correct (Ben Still)
2) The last change is not showing up in the list of changes (RH column, with time, editor as header items). Not sure if this is intentional, but is not intuitive if this is correct.
fields.summary: Recent changes information incorrect

fields.description:
See the attached gif. This occurs when starting up Confluence without the JDBC drivers being set on the classpath.

We should at least show the 500 jsp; it would be better to handle this with a Johnson event, which is what we do, for example, when dealing with a corrupted applicationContext.xml.
fields.summary: Use error page if Confluence is running but missing JDBC drivers on classpath

fields.description:
When you create a backup or export, it gets dumped in the temp directory. Anyone who can guess (or intercept) the filename can get hold of the file. That's bad.

When you create a backup/export (or anything else that gets served from temp), we should put some key in the session that allows that user (and that user only) to download the file.
fields.summary: Contents of the temp directly (i.e. backups/exports) not sufficiently protected

fields.description:
Instead of
 
h3. 1. First Header

...

h3. 2. Second Header

Allow for a tag to produce something like what we do for numbered lists (#), except apply them to the header. For an outlandish example,

h3# First Header
...

h3# Second Header
fields.summary: Allow Numbered headings

fields.description:
Pre-condition: User is viewing a page

Suppose the user decides to add a page.  Confluence presents the user with the new page template.  If the user decides against adding the new page and selects the Cancel button, Confluence directs the user to an alphabetical listing of pages.

It would be nice if Confluence would take the user back to the page from which the "Add  page" operation was initiated.  

Over and above this being the logical (or expected) response, it is very hard to re-locate the page on which one was from an alphabetical listing.

The same problem arises when the user cancels a "New Blog Post" operation.
fields.summary: What to do when upon a "Cancel" request

fields.description:
Since A3, "incoming links" are one click away (aka hidden) in "Page Information". Our beta users have complained about this - this removes a lot of context information which would be much more valuable when on "the page".
Suggestion: Move the incoming links back, leave the outgoing links on "page information".
fields.summary: CLONE -Move "incoming links" back to the page

fields.description:
Add a plugin point for indexing an object in the search index.

This will allow:

* Plugins to save arbitrary object attributes in the Lucene index for later retrieval
* Plugins for indexing new attachment types
fields.summary: Search indexing plugins

fields.description:
If a link is added at the end of a sentence, the period at the end of the sentence is included as part of the URL. While this can easily be avoided (by including a space after the URL), this is not exactly intuitive.

Depending on where the URL is pointing, this can cause an apparently broken link.

For example, this link would currently "break":

You can find NMock at http://sourceforge.net/projects/nmock.

However this is fine:

You can find NMock at http://sourceforge.net/projects/nmock .
fields.summary: Links at end of sentences can include extra periods

If this returns true, the MacroRendererComponent should fail if an end tag is not found.
If this returns false, the MacroRendererComponent should not search for an end tag.

Add a checkbox for user macros to ask if they have a body or not.
fields.summary: Macros can choose if they need a body or not.

fields.description:
Have a log management feature like JIRA: an Administration screen that allows you to configure the log4j levels.

We should ship with at least two pre-defined levels: "Production" and "Diagnostic", and an push-button way to switch between the two. (And another button to mail the current log to support?)
fields.summary: Enable administrator to change loglevels at runtime
Admin view of server logs

fields.description:
On a non-white background (such as a recent comment) the (y) image (a thumbs up) has a white halo.

We should also check that other such images have a transparent background.
fields.summary: (y) thumbs up image needs a transparent background

fields.description:
From a conversation on the user mailing-list.

atlassian-mail.cfg.xml saves itself as XML declaring a UTF-8 charset, but it's not necessarily saved in that charset - so if you get the charset wrong and it's written out, it may create invalid UTF-8 characters and refuse to load itself.

We seem to get this a little too often when we save XML files.
fields.summary: atlassian-mail.cfg.xml saves as wrong character set

fields.description: Should work the same way as the date parameter in the last-blogs macro. Eg lastModified=3d means "last modified in the last three days"
fields.summary: Add "lastModified" parameter to search macro

fields.description:
JIRA currently does this - if you've enabled LDAP support, authentication doesn't fall back on local auth. In Confluence, if you get the LDAP password wrong, you can still fall back on attempting to match the password in the local DB.

Apparently JIRA are using a hacked OSUser provider - if we adopt the same hack, we're fine.
fields.summary: If LDAP provider fails to authenticate, do not fall back on local osuser auth

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2853].
{panel}
It would be good to allow notifications to include an entire family of pages - so you can opt to watch a page and be notified if it changes, if any of its children change, or if any child page is added or removed.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of November 15, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion.

We fully appreciate the value of being able to easily watch a page and it's children with one click, and understand the value this would bring to you.

This is something we’d ideally like to implement in the future, but it's not currently on our roadmap for the next 12 months. We’re instead focusing on bringing you a new search experience, and are investigating improvements to permissions.

For more context on this, take a read of the Community blog: [A renewed approach to highly voted Server suggestions for Jira and Confluence|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117].

Alternatively, please take a look at the free [Tree View app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213286/tree-view], available in our Marketplace, which offers this functionality.

Best,
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Watch Page and Children

fields.description:
Please add functionality to add the 'target' attribute to an anchor tag in a page. This allows a user to open such things as word and pdf documents without them having to replace the confluence window in which they are browsing.

Eg. <a href="somewhere" target="_new">

Thanks,
Michael
fields.summary: Provide ability to add target attribute to an anchor.
unable to download current release

fields.description: My users would like to be able to sort search results by date. This is especially important for them when searching blog postings for a particular topic but only wanting to see the most recent entries.
fields.summary: Sort Search Results by Date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2849].
  {panel}

The 'Choose a Page' screen is very useful for selecting parent pages etc, but it doesn't contain an easy way to 'visualise' the space to find the page you're after. Particularly for choosing parent pages, sometimes it's easier to find an appropriate parent if you can see the full hierachy of pages. Not being able to do this can get a little frustrating (for me at least!), it has to be said.

Would it be possible to add another 'tab' to the 'Choose a page' screen which displays the page hierachy (with a drop-down to choose which space to view, probably) and allows the user to select this way?

Thanks,

Paul
fields.summary: Add support for page hierachy view on "Choose a page" screen

fields.description:
Sulka notes:

If you use the {rss} or {jiraissues} macro to access another server using SSL (https), and the remote server has an SSL certificate that is not registered with Confluence's JVM, the web request will hang indefinitely, eventually exhausting all the Confluence server threads.

We need to have some way to prevent this from occurring - it might be pretty deep inside the JDK though.
fields.summary: Unregistered SSL certificates can cause http requests to hang indefinitely

fields.description:
When attaching a file into Confluence, the filename character casing is not preserved and forced to be lowercase.

This causes issues when versioning with existing documentations with different filename character casing. For example, attaching the document will actually create another file (all lowercase) in Confluence. Deleting one will delete both files.  Nice.  =o)
fields.summary: Attaching files do not preserve filename character casing

fields.description:
I'm Korean.
We are considering to buy the confluene, so I tested. 
I installed confluence demo version. 

So, I wanna do key word search  in Korean.
But I couldn't do that.

So, I tested key word search  in Korean at confluence demo site. 

I can search through confluence search in Japanese and Chinese at demo site.

but, I can't search through confluence search in Korean at demo site.

Does the Lucene have some problems? 
Or, Confluence does?
fields.summary: Can't search in confluence search in Korean

fields.description:
If I create a page with the following content
----
h2. Subversion
[*Subversion*|http://subversion.tigris.org] should be used in preference to any alternatives when starting a new project.

Fire2 this should change in the future hosts the *Subversion* source repositories.
----

I don't get a break of any kind between the "project." and "Fire2".

If I add a line break either before or after the "h2. Subversion", then I get the proper paragraph breaks.

The introduction of a starting line break (either before or after the first heading) has a flow on effect to subsequent headings.

-- fails to put paragraph breaks --
h2. Subversion
[*Subversion*|http://subversion.tigris.org] should be used in preference to any alternatives when starting a new project.

Fire2 this should change in the future hosts the *Subversion* source repositories.

h2. Visual Source Safe
*VSS* is used to manage the fireweb asp pages and the IFIS stored procedures.

The *VSS* repository can be found at
bq server\e$\Development\VSS
----

vs

-- paragraph breaks work --

h2. Subversion
[*Subversion*|http://subversion.tigris.org] should be used in preference to any alternatives when starting a new project.

Fire2 this should change in the future hosts the *Subversion* source repositories.

h2. Visual Source Safe
*VSS* is used to manage the fireweb asp pages and the IFIS stored procedures.

The *VSS* repository can be found at
bq server\e$\Development\VSS
----

vs

-- paragraph breaks work --
h2. Subversion

[*Subversion*|http://subversion.tigris.org] should be used in preference to any alternatives when starting a new project.

Fire2 this should change in the future hosts the *Subversion* source repositories.

h2. Visual Source Safe
*VSS* is used to manage the fireweb asp pages and the IFIS stored procedures.

The *VSS* repository can be found at
bq server\e$\Development\VSS
----

fields.description:
I have a user macro named "CurrentRelease", which currently returns "Release2_42"

Page "Release2_42" exists.

On the home page for a space I have the following
--
Click [Here|{CurrentRelease}] for the current release.
--

The link works fine but has the little green + beside it indicating that it's available for creation.

If I inline the user macro myself then the + goes away.

Using the following doesn't work either.
--
Click [Here|{CurrentRelease}{CurrentRelease}] for the current release.
--
fields.summary: Existing link shows '+' when generated via UserMacro

fields.description:
When adding a comment to a blog post, a collegue (who we've been trying to convince to use confluence more often) clicked the preview button.

There appeared to be no way to get back from the preview to actually post the comment.

He clicked the back button and BOOM!  The blog entry and all its comments had forgotten what space they were in.  The result is that blog entry and it's comments can no longer be accessed.

When we view the dashboard, this is the type of thing we see:

-------------------------
 Re: Thoughts on build environment and dependancy engine   ($content.page.space.name)
Guy's solution. During the build process we generate a file (possibly part of the main stub file) which contains a translation table between hashed full class names,... 
-------------------------

Note the $content.page.space.name bit

When we try to access the blog entry, this is what we get:

-------------------------
The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for.
-------------------------

If we enter the space in which the blog was made, we get something like this:

-------------------------
CONFLUENCE
System Error
A system error has occurred - our apologies!

Please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
   3. attach the application server log file (if possible). 

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Cause:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2813].
  {panel}

I like to leave comment posting enabled for "anonymous" users, but I don't like the fact that the database structure doesn't allow for names or addesses attached to those.

This is a simple client-side (javascript based) patch that modifies the form for anonymous comment posters and forces them to enter a "name" and an address.

Upon checking, then the comment is modified as follows:

Name [address] wrote:
{quote}
The original comment
{quote}

It would be great if this was implemented server side (as it's not very safe done this way) but at least I can track down whoever posts comments on the site.

Given its client-side implementation, though, now people cannot preview their comments anymore.

It would be a great feature for 1.4 final (and shouldn't be a big change to implement it on the server side, just a couple of extra parameters to track in the tiny comment-posting workflow.

Attached is a patch against 1.4-DR4a, you can see it running on http://blossom.betaversion.org/~pier/
fields.summary: Improve anonymous comments by recording name and address

It would be great if this could be corrected... thanks in advance.

Stephan

fields.description:
(I searched JIRA to see if this issue already exists and did not find anything.)

I suggest creating a macro that would allow for a region of a page to be expanded or collapsed-- not unlike how comments and children are handled.  In some cases, we have lengthy pages with sections that might be better served by having a user drill-down into its contents rather than displaying all of the contents.  While it might be a reasonable work-around to create other [child] pages, that does not suit some of the documents/pages that we have created.
fields.summary: macro to allow for expand/collapse of a section or region of the page

-----
While this seems to work ok on 1.4dr4, someone look in the attachments directory, and be sure a misnamed directory is not hanging around.

Steps I did to try to reproduce it:
-files with 'Drawing.png' and 'drawing.png' were attached
-showed up as a version. OK.
- deleted.
- files 'drawing.png' wasattached
- manual rename to 'Drawing.png'
- added 'drawing.png'
- two different files showed up
- deleted 'drawing.png'
both attachments disappeared.

test page was
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/18YB

fields.description:
I record a lot of sysadmin scripts into Confluence.  The {code} macro is nice for this but the Bash scripts end up looking a little weird with Java highlighting.  XML and SQL are even worse.

I'd really like to see bash/sh syntax supported in the {code} macro.  Even better would be if the {code} macro used some extensible highlighter library like jedit-syntax or Colorer.


http://sourceforge.net/projects/jedit-syntax/

http://colorer.sourceforge.net/
fields.summary: Support Bash script syntax highlighting in {code} macro

fields.description:
From investigation of the ConcurrentModificationException bug this week, it turns out that JBoss and Jetty are logging Hibernate at DEBUG level. We don't know how or where this is happening, but it's GOT to be a serious performance problem since every session is being dumped to a String at some point.

We need to work out why this is happening, and how to prevent it.
fields.summary: Log Levels on JBoss/Jetty seem screwed

Nov 10, 2004 7:58:30 PM net.sf.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate execute
SEVERE: Syntax error or access violation message from server: "Specified key was too long; max key l
ength is 1024 bytes" 

or in summary: 

"Specified key was too long; max key length is 1024 bytes"

Because a UTF-8 character is stored as three bytes in MySQL the maximum key length can only be 1024/3 characters long. The compound key in the os_propertyentry table seems to be violating this constraint.

Not sure whats going on - but sometimes hitting a space homepage takes over 10 sec to respond...

fields.description:
Scenario: trying to add a new space via xmlrpc.  End up in ConfluenceXmlRpcHandlerImpl.addSpace(...),  BeanUtils.populate is called with the freshly created RemoteSpace and the map passed in over xmlrpc.

If debug level logging is enabled, BeanUtils.populate logs the bean using toString (and thus hashCode since there is no custom toString on RemoteSpaceSummary). The logging occurs prior to the bean being populated with the values from the Map

However: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteSpaceSummary.hashCode() fire a NullPointerException if the key is not set.




FWIW: It took me way too long to track this bug down - the stack traces were getting swallowed inside the XMLRPC handler.  Although I will accept that that might have been my fault (through bad jetty config) than anything else.  If it wasn't my fault that the stack traces were swallowed, then there should be a better way to make them show up.

The exception being thrown out of the xmlrpc interfaces are pretty non-descript - eg. "Bad error, uh oh"
fields.summary: RemoteSpaceSummary.hashCode has NPE if key is not set

fields.description:
Our Confluence production environment has crashed many times during the last few days because some transaction is never ended and the database connection isn't closed. The transaction has obtained locks to content and therefore blocks all updates to certain rows. This causes connection pool to be exhausted and Confluence is no more able to service any users.

Checking from the database, there is an open connection with event "SQL*Net message from client" meaning that it waits for the client. The connection has obtained locks to content and other tables as well. The connection is established from the Confluence server for sure and has been idle/waiting for hours.
fields.summary: Database connection is not closed and transaction isn't ended
